body: I'm not sure this is known, but the Flutter plugin is incompatible with the latest IntelliJ version (2021.3) which was released this week.

comment_data.body:
I was about to report the same.
More details:
```
IntelliJ IDEA 2021.3 (Community Edition)
Build #IC-213.5744.223, built on November 27, 2021
```

```
flutter doctor -v
[√] Flutter (Channel stable, 2.5.3, on Microsoft Windows [Version 10.0.19044.1387], locale it-CH)
    • Flutter version 2.5.3 at C:\flutter
    • Upstream repository https://github.com/flutter/flutter.git
    • Framework revision 18116933e7 (7 weeks ago), 2021-10-15 10:46:35 -0700
    • Engine revision d3ea636dc5
    • Dart version 2.14.4
```

I just upgraded to 2021.3 Ultimate on Intel Mac, and I get the following error in the Event Log:

`2:07 PM	Plugin error: Plugin 'Flutter' (version '62.0.3') is not compatible with the current version of the IDE, because it requires build 212.* or older but the current build is IU-213.5744.223`

Someone help! Just upgraded my IDE and having this exacly same problem:

Help us @devoncarew, you're our only hope!!

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1146982/144129744-eacd1f64-6204-410f-99e1-af550f85f016.png)
You need to downgrade @shinayser

Man... what a bummer... thought this was gonna be a smooth update and then bam!

@bernaferrari do you know if there's a way to downgrade from the IDE? Or only downloading 2021.2?

EDIT:

Never mind, I just redownloaded 2021.2.3 and reinstalled the plugins (including dart - dart was updated to be compatible with 2021.3 so you'll have to downgrade it as well)
@eestein just open toolbox, select intellij and click on downgrade. One click, there is no download needed.
Any idea of the timeline for fixing this?
cc'ing @stevemessick so he's aware

I think this is fixed by #5875 
Everything seems fine now.

I am still seeing the IntelliJ error:

> Plugin 'Flutter' (version '62.0.3') is not compatible with the current version of the IDE, because it requires build 212.* or older but the current build is IU-213.5744.223

When should we expect the fix to be in a published release?
It is. Settings -> Plugin -> Update All
I must have updated too soon. I was able to download the updated version. Thanks.

Can it be that this issue still exists?

I'm running:
- Intellij Ultimate 2021.3 Build #IU-213.5744.223, built on November 27, 2021
- Flutter plugin 63.0.5
- Dart plugin 213.5744.122
- Flutter -v output:

Tools • Dart 2.14.4
```

```

I cannot update any plugins anymore in Intellij, all plugins are up-to-date.
No, this was fixed. But my colleague has the same error and it works fine. Maybe you could open a new issue?

Still not working. If I delete Dart.jar the exception gone.
This should be reopened, it is still/again an issue.

@darshankawar  I had it crash after upgrading to 2021.3 but before upgrading to 2.8.0.  looks me like the crash is related to flutter_tools unzipping and trying to parse an XML file inside the  flutter-idea-xx.x.x.jar file.  The routines inside flutter_tools haven't changed in a while.

@ryanawhelan 
Thanks. We've reopened original issue to track this from flutter tool side. https://github.com/flutter/flutter/issues/94478 please follow-up in it.
There seems to be already an original issue to track, so please follow-up in https://github.com/flutter/flutter/issues/94060

IntelliJ IDEA community edition v2021.3 (Build #IC-213.5744.223, built on November 27, 2021)

Flutter SDK: 2.8.0 Stable

Build #IU-213.5744.223, built on November 27, 2021

I downgrade IntelliJ From 2021.3 -> 2021.2.3 and now it works.

This is NOT a solution.

Same here, and I agreed it's not a solution. 
Running IntelliJ IDEA 2021.3 Ultimate Edition
Flutter 2.8.1 with 63.2.4 plugin latest compatible version
and
Dart 2.15.1 with 213.574.122 plugin latest compatible version

The issue is not resolved.

I have the latest available version of everything. What else I'm supposed to do?

![Screenshot 2021-12-27 135355](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/31741561/147462706-b7a3cf32-097a-4205-92b5-7ce7ecbdcc51.png)

![Screenshot 2021-12-27 135445](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/31741561/147462745-277b341f-a0a4-41b9-8db3-bf8711f70d50.png)

@omidshojaee I think your best bet is to follow Flutter issue [#94060](https://github.com/flutter/flutter/issues/94060).  If you have to use IDEA, then you can roll back to an older version or if that's not critical, you can use Android Studio. That's what I've been doing and it's fine.

It is recommended to install and use IntelliJ IDEA 2021.2.4 Ultimate Edition additionally. 
Then the error goes away. Use this method until the problem is resolved.
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/58944350/148704924-d414afe9-3c37-42a7-beac-5388c1ac7672.png)
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/58944350/148704934-3dabd82b-42fa-49eb-8a10-1669ae7556ed.png)
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/58944350/148704944-94eb854c-8fe8-4abe-be95-e09079bc1d56.png)
Rollback/Downgrade is not a SOLUTION.
This issue is about flutter plugin not working at all. The flutter doctor issue is another one.

I had the same problem and had to downgrade IntelliJ to 21.2.x to fix it.
I hope this problem to be fixed also you latest IntelliJ version.

I had the same problem 
Running IntelliJ IDEA 2021.3.2 (Ultimate Edition)

I found solution: 
changed branch to master (it's already fixed in the master)
and it works)))

![2022-02-01_221817](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/3526006/152044608-edfcdafb-0a60-4fc1-b062-4fb5b04c7385.jpg)
I have the same issue. For me switching to flutter "master" channel helped as well.
any update about this?

flutter channel 'master'
flutter upgrade

works for me on ubuntu and macos

> flutter channel 'master' flutter upgrade
> 
> works for me on ubuntu and macos

Worked in Manjaro too

> flutter channel 'master' flutter upgrade
> 
> works for me on ubuntu and macos

work on windows 10

title: Update plugin to IntelliJ 2021.3
